page.title: 16HOLME MILLS
page.content: THE MILL IN OUR VILLAGE WAS ONCE A COCONUT MATTING MILL.THE CHILDREN WOULD START WHEN THEY WERE TEN.THEY WOULD HAVE HALF A DAY WORKING AND HALF A DAY AT SCHOOL.ELDERLY PEOPLE HAD TO WORK FROM SIX IN THE MORNING UNTIL SIX AT NIGHT.THEY HAD NINE DAYS OFF A YEAR THEY WORKED ON MACHINES WHICH WOVE COCONUT FIBRE INTO COCONUT MATTING. BEFORE THE MILL WAS A COCONUT MATTING MILL IT WAS A SAW MILL AND MOST OF THEIR WORKERS CAME FROM WAKEFIELD PRISON.NOW THE MILL IS AN INDUSTRIAL UNIT.WHEN THE WAR WAS ON THE WORKERS GOT NINE SHILLINGS A WEEK.LATER THE WAGES GRADUALLY GOT BETTER.IN WORLD WAR TWO SOME MILLS HAD TO START MAKING CAMOUFLAGED MATTING FOR THE ARMY TO COVER UP GUNS, TANKS,AND RUNWAYS.THEY MADE THE CAMOUFLAGED MATTING BY DYEING THE YARN GREEN AND BROWN THEN PUTTING IT ON HANKS.
